ext_description.p:
A Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is a type of . A Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is the association between one
and another , where one is in the
(design view) and the other is in the .
ext_description.note: The main use of this concept is to support the identification of the connector in an assembly design view that is related to a connector in a usage view for that assembly. In many cases the reference designator for the usage view is different than that of the design view, and the full details of the connector in the usage view may not be provided. In many cases, the product is not the same product as well, if there are multiple levels of assembly between the design view at which the connector is installed and the product at which the connector is made visible for interface purposes.
ext_description.example: A connector in a PCA assembly may be J1 in that assembly. The unit in which the PCA is a low level subassembly (with a partial reference designation itself of A1A3A4) may have an access hole in the cover which makes the connector directly visible and may have identification of that connector at the product level of J12. In this case the design organization would know that A1A3A4J1 was represented at the unit level as J12.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an
for the Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment.

specifies an
for the Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment.
The usage_view_component shall not be an ancestor, either directly or indirectly of the design_view_component. The inverse shall also be true.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p: A Connection_zone_in_design_view is a type of that is created to support design specific connection areas.
ext_description.note:
A Connection_zone_in_design_view usually has a geometric model associated with it. The placement of that geometric model in the design view geometric model is accomplished with a member of
or with a member of .
The terminal that uses the may be discovered by a simple query.
ext_description.example: A wire whose overall length is design specific may have process requirements for soldering to connection areas on the wire ends. In that case a Connection_zone_in_design_view would be provided to indicate the design specific connection area since the geometric placement of the area is only available in the design.

A trace which is required to be examined under highly detailed constraint conditions may include a connection zone in order to explicitly define the point domain for a connection. In this scenario a member of Connection_zone_in_design_view would be provided.
ext_description.note: An application scenario that includes use of Connection_zone_in_design_view in a layout design should be carefully examined to validate the data requirements as this Application Object is rarely required in usual industrial practice.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
for which the shape is composed for the Connection_zone_in_design_view.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Part_design_view is a type of
and a type of . A Part_design_view may describe an item in sufficient detail to permit production of that item in a manufacturing process or analysis of that item's response to a simulated environment in a computer based experimental environment. The case of analysis is supported by predefined analysis input and output shape models in addition to the design shape model. Multiple shape models may reference the same Part_design_view. When multiple shape models reference the same Part_design_view, the individual shape models have different purposes in the design process. Multiple shape models may reference one Part_design_view when it is desired to have one set of features to be included in the view. For each part level shape model there would be a separate shape model for the feature in the context of that part level shape model, but the identification of the feature and the relationship of the feature to the Part_design_view is invariant. The version attribute inherited from
need not reference the same product version referenced by the
that this view references in the role of usage_view.
ext_description.note: The decision of how much detail to incorporate in a design view is dependent on the enterprise process, in particular in the case of data sharing in a supply chain. Pre-processor implementations may be required to include information rights, information rights usages, approvals, and additional contextual information inherited from such as view definition contexts. Pre-processors intended to support analysis may be required to extract partial data when complete data sets would overwhelm analysis applications. Pre-processors intended to support supply chains may be required to convert design intent information into a form less suitable for reverse engineering of the design model. The additional contextual information is not available in CAD layout systems but will need to be provided by other input to the Pre-processor.

In electrical and electronic design processes, it is common practice to analyse the design information provided to manufacturing in addition to idealizations of the design created for analysis purposes.
ext_description.example: It is typical in a supply chain process not to include template information in the model transmitted to lower tier suppliers but that information is critical to the design organization.
It is typical in a supply chain process not to include requirement allocation information in the model transmitted to lower tier suppliers but that information is critical to the design organization.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates an assembly design view.

ext_description.p: An Assembly_item_number is an association of a set of with an identifier in the context of a physical design. The identifier shall not contain any spaces or punctuation. All members of the set of reference the same part with the consequence that an Assembly_item_number collects all applications of a part in a design into one item.
ext_description.note: Requirements and instructions may apply to a set of , not just to an individual.
An INTEGER is normally used as an item number.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Assembly_item_number.
specifies a string to identify Assembly_item_number.

ext_description.p:
An Assembly_alternate_product is a type of
where the alternate relationship is limited to the scope of a specific design definition.
ext_description.note: A product may be an alternate within the context of a consumer product intended for casual use but not within the context of a commercial product that requires guaranteed availability levels.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Assembly_alternate_product.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Component_feature_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is the association between the
and the . The purpose for this assignment is to link the product data in the design view to the product data in the usage view for traceability purposes.
ext_description.note: In an archive, both a design view and a usage view are archived together, with this relationship populated as necessary to provide linkages between the features in the usage view and the features in the design view. Without this linkage populated, there is no way to guarantee traceability between a design view and a usage view, without evaluating the design view and the usage view in detail.

In the case where this part of ISO 10303 is used to exchange or store designs that may be used in higher level assemblies, the usage view is provided to the designers of those higher level assemblies, and this entity allows the interface definitions to the next level assemblies to be carefully controlled. Note that the usage view is an as-designed view. The requirements unit of functionality in this part of ISO 10303 supports the as-required view of the interface to the next higher assembly in a top-down design paradigm. This part of ISO 10303 supports explicitly exchanging those data separately so that traceability is provided from requirements to as-designed life-cycle states in the same exchange file.

This information is provided for the case where a
is suitable directly as a feature of the assembly.
Most types will be interface types.

ext_description.p: A Component_material_relationship is a means to provide the ability to relate at a component level a process specific assembly requirement that bonds two items together using a third item as the bonding agent. Each item may be referenced by either it's item number or, in the case of an , by it's .
ext_description.note: The references are made in the context of a specific design view so will need to be duplicated for revisions of the design in which the same bonding support is required.
ext_description.example:
This AO is primarily intended to state how fluid like or bulk material (tape) is attached to discrete components, either to bond them or to cover them. In the case of two components glued together individually
might seem to be useful but the problem is that one has to specify the two group members anyway. Also a significant number of situations is the component is glued to the PWB, and we don't want to modify the semantics of
with respect to movement.
ext_description.note: This Application Object provides no information about the location of the material. If detailed information on shape and location of material is required, the material should be modeled explicitly as a member of , or in the case of electrically or thermally active material, .
A keepout shape may support defining the area within which to keep a bonding agent for the case that an explicit shape is inappropriate.

Each item number or assembly relationship referenced by component_1 shall relate to the associated_design as the assembly construct in the relationship.
Each item number or assembly relationship referenced by component_2 shall relate to the associated_design as the assembly construct in the relationship.
Each item number or assembly relationship referenced by material shall relate to the associated_design as the assembly construct in the relationship.
Each item number or assembly relationship referenced by specification shall relate to the associated_design as the assembly construct in the relationship.

If a specific feature of a component is fastened to a specific feature of another component, the
shall be provided and this AO shall not be provided.
